item.title: Version 1.9.10
item.description:
v1.9.10

What’s New

🎨 Redesigned Template Editor

I’ve completely overhauled the template creation experience to make it more intuitive and powerful:

  • Cleaner, card-based layout - Each section is clearly organized in its own card for better visual hierarchy
  • Live filename preview - See exactly how your files will be renamed as you build your template
  • Smarter field suggestions - Get intelligent suggestions for extraction fields based on your template name (e.g., naming a template “Invoice” suggests fields like “Invoice Date” and “Total Amount”)
  • Contextual help everywhere - Helpful tips and examples are now available throughout the interface

🔤 Advanced Filename Formatting

Take full control over how your files are renamed:

  • Static prefixes and suffixes - Add fixed text at the beginning or end of every filename (e.g., “RE_” prefix or “_SIGNED” suffix)
  • Custom separators - Choose any character to separate extracted fields in your filenames

🪄 Powerful Text Transformations

New transformation rules let you clean up extracted text automatically:

  • Remove unwanted characters - Strip out punctuation, special characters, or formatting
  • Normalize text - Convert “São Paulo” to “Sao Paulo”, dates to consistent formats
  • Case conversions - Change to lowercase, uppercase, or title case
  • Smart replacements - Replace spaces with hyphens, remove leading zeros, and more
  • Sequential processing - Apply multiple transformations in order for precise control

🚀 Performance & Usability Improvements

  • Faster template testing - The template tester now uses your actual file’s content for more accurate results
  • Improved validation - Clear error messages guide you when required fields are missing
  • Responsive UI - Smoother interactions and better visual feedback throughout

🐛 Bug Fixes

  • Fixed sheet resizing issues - dialogs now open at their intended size
  • Resolved auto-focus behavior that could select all text unexpectedly when opening the template editor
  • Fixed various UI glitches in the template creation flow
  • Improved stability when working with complex transformation rules

Tips for Using the New Features

Creating Better Templates: - Start with a descriptive template name - it helps generate relevant field suggestions - Use the preview to verify your filename format before saving - Test your template with actual files to ensure it extracts the right information

Using Transformations: - Add transformation rules to handle inconsistent data (e.g., different date formats) - Use “Remove diacritics” to ensure filenames work across all systems - Apply multiple transformations to clean up messy extracted text

Static Text in Filenames: - Use prefixes for categorization (e.g., “INV_” for invoices, “RPT_” for reports) - Add suffixes for status indicators (e.g., “_DRAFT”, “_FINAL”, “_SIGNED”)

This update makes NameQuick’s template system more powerful while keeping it easy to use. Your existing templates will continue to work exactly as before, but now you have many more options when creating new ones.
